intro: Phyllanthus racemifer, commonly known as the racemifer spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers, which are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. Phyllanthus racemifer is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
